page.title: 09Minera Quarry
page.content: The Tarmac Roadstone Quarry can be found cutting into the side of Minera Mountain.In the quarry they produce limestone which is used mainly for building roads,paths and car parks. Twenty four men work there,sixteen on production, and there are big noisy machines and trucks.Although it's a noisy place,birds nest in the rocks and a fox is rearing her cubs near to all the activity. It is hard work and the quarry is open to driving rain,wind and snow which sweep across the mountain.In the summer when it is light the men work from 6am to 5pm but in the winter they might work from 7am to 4pm.About one hundred and fifty lorry loads of dry and coated aggregate leave the quarry every day.At the present rate of demand there's enough rock to last from five to seven years.
